api_list.name: Acute Kidney Injury According to AKIN Criteria
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return the AKIN classification for Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) when provided with a serum creatinine criterion and/or a urine output criterion.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 17331245](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17331245/) / [DOI: 10.1186/cc5713](https://doi.org/10.1186/cc5713)
2. [PMID: 27818745](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27818745/) / [DOI: 10.1093/ckj/sfs160](https://doi.org/10.1093/ckj/sfs160)
3. [PMID: 26639440](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26639440/) / [DOI: 10.1038/srep17917](https://doi.org/10.1038/srep17917)
4. [PMID: 30235738](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30235738/) / [DOI: 10.1097/MD.0000000000012465](https://doi.org/10.1097/md.0000000000012465)
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://medapi2.p.rapidapi.com/calculators/akin"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "medapi2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) with the Revised Schwartz Equation (2009)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate for paediatric individuals based on the revised Schwartz Equation (2009).
Calculations are based on body length and serum creatinine concentration.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 19158356](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19158356/) / [DOI: 10.1681/ASN.2008030287](https://doi.org/10.1681/asn.2008030287)
2. [PMID: 20652327](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20652327/) / [DOI: 10.1007/s00467-010-1598-7](https://doi.org/10.1007/s00467-010-1598-7)

allOf.title: ManagementEnum
enum: Consider temporarily holding ICPi, pending consideration of potential alternative etiologies (recent IV contrast, medications, fluid status) and baseline renal function. A change that is still < 1.5 ULN could be meaningful

Hold ICPi temporarily Consult nephrology. Evaluate for other causes (recent IV contrast, medications, fluid status, etc); if other etiologies ruled out, administer 0.5–1 mg/kg/d prednisone equivalents. If worsening or no improvement: 1 to 2 mg/kg/d prednisone equivalents and permanently discontinue treatment. If improved to G1 or less, taper corticosteroids over 4-6 weeks. If no recurrence of chronic renal insufficiency, discuss resumption of ICPI with patient after taking into account the risks and benefits.
Consult nephrology. Evaluate for other causes (recent IV contrast, medications, fluid status, etc). Administercorticosteroids (initial dose of 1-2 mg/kg/d prednisone or equivalent).

api_list.name: Chronic Kidney Disease Prediction in HIV Positive Patients
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return a Score and probability for Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) in HIV positive patients using the following criteria:
 
- 'Age 19-39/40-49/50-59/60-90 years'
- 'Blood Glucose > 140 mg/dL'
- 'Systolic BP <140 mmHg'
- 'Hypertension'
- 'Triglycerides >200 mg/dL'
- 'Proteinuria'
- 'CD4+ <200 cells/uL'
- 'Tenovir (TDF) use'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 24922479](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24922479/) / [DOI: 10.1097/QAD.0000000000000258](https://doi.org/10.1097/qad.0000000000000258)
2. [PMID: 25963593](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25963593/) / [DOI: 10.1038/nrneph.2015.75](https://doi.org/10.1038/nrneph.2015.75)

api_list.name: McMahon Score for Rhabdomyolysis
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the McMahon Risk Score for Rhabdomyolysis to predict mortality or acute kidney injury (AKI) in patients with rhabdomyolysis.
The risk score, risk group and recommendation are derived from the following criteria:

- Biological sex.
- Age range.
- Initial creatinine.
- 'Initial calcium <7.5 mg/dL (1.88 mmol/L)'
- 'Initial CPK >40,000 U/L'
- 'Rhabdo secondary to seizures, syncope, exercise, statins, or myositis'.
- 'Initial bicarbonate <19 mEq/L (19 mmol/L)'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 24000014](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24000014/) / [DOI: 10.1001/jamainternmed.2013.9774](https://doi.org/10.1001/jamainternmed.2013.9774)
2. [PMCID: PMC4470963](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4470963/) / [DOI: 10.1186/cc14363](https://dx.doi.org/10.1186%2Fcc14363)

api_list.name: Model For End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score (Original, pre-2016)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Model For End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score individual (Original, pre-2016 model) including estimated 3-month mortality rate.
Results will be calculated from serum creatinine concentration, serum bilirubin concentration, international normalised ratio and whether the individual had dialysis at least twice in the past week or CVVHD for ≥24 hours in the past week.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 11172350](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11172350/) / [DOI: 10.1053/jhep.2001.22172](https://doi.org/10.1053/jhep.2001.22172)
2. [PMID: 12512033](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12512033/) / [DOI: 10.1053/gast.2003.50016](https://doi.org/10.1053/gast.2003.50016)
3. [PMID: 14999695](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/14999695/) / [DOI: 10.1002/hep.20083](https://doi.org/10.1002/hep.20083)
4. [PMID: 17326206](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17326206/) / [DOI: 10.1002/hep.21563](https://doi.org/10.1002/hep.21563)

api_list.name: Kinetic Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (kinetic eGFR)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Kinetic Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate of an individual. Calculations are based on the individual's age, sex, whether the individual is of black race, base line (steady state) serum creatinine concentration, serum creatinine concentration at first timepont and second timepoint.

### Evidence

1. [PMID: 23704286](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23704286/) / [DOI: 10.1681/ASN.2012070653](https://doi.org/10.1681/asn.2012070653)
2. [PMID: 28396736](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28396736/) / [DOI: 10.1093/ckj/sfw108](https://doi.org/10.1093/ckj/sfw108)

api_list.name: Mekhail Extension of the Motzer Score for Prediction of Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Survival
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Mekhail Extension of the Motzer Score and will provide the associated risk group and metastatic renal cell carcinoma survival prediction. 
Calculations are based on the following criteria:

- 'Lactate dehydrogenase >1.5 times upper limit of normal (normal: 140 U/L)'
- 'Hemoglobin below lower limit of normal (normal: <12 g/dL (120 g/L))'
- 'Corrected serum calcium above 10 mg/dL (2.5 mmol/L)'
- 'Less than 1 year from time of diagnosis to systemic therapy'
- 'Prior treatment with radiation'
- '2 or more sites of metastasis'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 15681528](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15681528/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2005.05.179](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2005.05.179)
2. [PMID: 24311955](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24311955/) / [DOI: 10.3747/co.20.1596](https://doi.org/10.3747/co.20.1596)
3. [PMID: 10561319](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10561319/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.1999.17.8.2530](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.1999.17.8.2530)
4. [PMID: 11773181](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11773181/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2002.20.1.289](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2002.20.1.289)

api_list.name: Licurse Score for Renal Ultrasound
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Licurse Score for Renal Ultrasound and will provide the associated risk group, risk of hydronephrosis requiring stent or nephrostomy tube placement and risk of hydronephrosis on imaging. 
Calculations are based on the following criteria:

- 'History of hydronephrosis in documented in last 2 years prior to renal ultrasound.'
- 'Individual is of black race.'
- 'History of urinary tract infections.'
- 'Diagnosis consistent with possible obstruction.'
- 'History of congestive heart failure.'
- 'History of sepsis or prerenal acute kidney injury, use of pressors, or hypotension.'
- 'Exposure to nephrotoxic medications prior to acute kidney injury.'

### Evidence

1. [PMID: 21098348](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21098348/) / [DOI: 10.1001/archinternmed.2010.419](https://doi.org/10.1001/archinternmed.2010.419)
2. [PMID: 27186959](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27186959/) / [DOI: 10.1002/jhm.2598](https://doi.org/10.1002/jhm.2598)

### JSON Bodies

#### Response body
If 'History of hydronephrosis in documented in last 2 years prior to renal ultrasound.' is 'True', the **licurse_score** field in the response body will return 'null'.

api_list.name: Body Fluid Balance
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Body Fluid Balance by fluids lost and gained. The net 0.9% saline and free water gain and loss will be calculated from the cumulative body fluids lost, cumulative IV solutions gained and cumulative enteral solutions gained.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 27616761](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27616761/) / [DOI: 10.5414/CN108721](https://doi.org/10.5414/cn108721)
2. [PMID: 17384437](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17384437/) / [DOI: 10.1001/jama.297.12.1319](https://doi.org/10.1001/jama.297.12.1319)
3. [PMID: 25595470](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25595470/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.amjmed.2014.12.020](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.amjmed.2014.12.020)

### JSON Bodies

#### Request body

Either positive or negative floats can be provided to *value* in each *volume* object. This will not effect final calculation of **total_saline_gained_lost** and **total_free_h2o_gained_lost** in the response body.
Optional fields that are omitted in the request body will be returned as 'null' in the response body.

#### Response body
Saline and free water gain is represented by a positive float, loss is represented by a negative float.

api_list.name: Creatinine Clearance (Cocroft-Gault (1976) Formula)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Creatinine Clearance of an individual using the Cocroft-Gault (1976) formula, Calculations are based on body weight, sex, age and serum creatinine concentration.
If the optional body length is entered, Creatinine Clearance will also be calculated using ideal body weight and adjusted body weight.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 1244564](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1244564/) / [DOI: 10.1159/000180580](https://doi.org/10.1159/000180580)
2. [PMID: 22576791](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22576791/) / [DOI: 10.1002/j.1875-9114.2012.01098.x](https://doi.org/10.1002/j.1875-9114.2012.01098.x)
3. [PMID: 23757387](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23757387/) / [DOI: 10.1345/aph.1S176](https://doi.org/10.1345/aph.1s176)

### JSON Bodies

## Request
For **mass** and **length**, at least one *unit\value* objects can be added to the array. If more than one *unit\value* objects (differing unit types are allowed) are added then these will then be summed and converted.
This is useful when for example combining 'ft' and 'in'.

Optional fields that are omitted in the request body will be returned as 'null' in the response body.

#### Response body

**ibw**, **abw**, **cr_cl_ibw** and **cr_cl_abw** will return 'null' if the optional **length** is omitted.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://medapi2.p.rapidapi.com/calculators/creatinine-clearance"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "medapi2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Bicarbonate Deficit
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return an individual's bicarbonate deficit, calculated using several different volume of distribution. Calculated using body mass and measured serum bicarbonate concentration [HCO₃-].
The desired serum bicarbonate can optionally also be set, but defaults to 24 mmol/L if this field is left blank.

### Evidence
1. [ISBN: 9781553956013 (page 68-150)](https://books.google.ie/books?id=7yoeWTBUfN0C)
2. [ISBN: 9780316924337 (page 59-63)](https://books.google.ie/books?id=ZdlsAAAAMAAJ&q)
3. [PMID: 17936961](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17936961/)
4. [PMID: 2693799](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2693799/) / [DOI: 10.1038/ki.1989.258](https://doi.org/10.1038/ki.1989.258)
5. [PMID: 18322160](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/18322160/) / [DOI: 10.1681/ASN.2007121329](https://doi.org/10.1681/asn.2007121329)

api_list.name: Free Water Deficit (Hypternatraemia) and Sodium Deficit (Hyponatraemia)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Free Water Deficit for an individual with hypernatraemia and the Sodium Deficit for an individual with hyponatraemia.
Calculations are based onthe individual's sex, age range, body mass, current serum sodium concentration and the desired ideal sodium concentration.
The deficits are expressed in positive values. Negative values indicate an excess.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 10816188](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10816188/) / [DOI: 10.1056/NEJM200005183422006](https://doi.org/10.1056/nejm200005183422006)
2. [PMID: 10824078](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10824078/) / [DOI: 10.1056/NEJM200005253422107](https://doi.org/10.1056/nejm200005253422107)

api_list.name: Anion Gap
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return an individual's anion gap, delta gap and delta ratio when provided with blood sodium concentration [Na+] (sodium), blood chlorine concentration [Cl-] (chlorine) and blood bicarbonate concentration [HCO₃-] (bicarbonate).
If the optional blood potassium concentration [K+] (potassium) is provided, a more accurate anion gap, delta gap and delta ratio will be returned. If the optional blood albumin concentration (albumin) is provided, the albumin-corrected anion gap, delta gap and delta ratio will additionally be returned.

api_list.name: Motzer Score for Prediction of Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Survival
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Motzer Score and will provide the associated risk group and metastatic renal cell carcinoma survival prediction. 
Calculations are based on the following criteria below:

- 'Lactate dehydrogenase >1.5 times upper limit of normal (normal: 140 U/L)'
- 'Hemoglobin below lower limit of normal (normal: <12 g/dL (120 g/L))'
- 'Corrected serum calcium above 10 mg/dL (2.5 mmol/L)'
- 'Less than 1 year from time of diagnosis to systemic therapy'
- 'Karnofsky Performance Status less than 80%'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 10561319](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10561319/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.1999.17.8.2530](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.1999.17.8.2530)
2. [PMID: 11773181](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11773181/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2002.20.1.289](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2002.20.1.289)
3. [PMID: 14752067](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/14752067/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2004.06.132](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2004.06.132)
4. [PMID: 15681528](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15681528/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2005.05.179](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2005.05.179)
5. [PMID: 19487381](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19487381/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2008.20.1293](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19487381/)
6. [PMID: 23312463](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23312463/) / [DOI: 10.1016/S1470-2045(12)70559-4](https://doi.org/10.1016/s1470-2045(12)70559-4)
7. [NCCN Guidelines](https://www.nccn.org/guidelines/category_1)

api_list.name: Stage, Size, Grade and Necrosis (SSIGN) Score for Renal Cell Carcinoma
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Stage, Size, Grade and Necrosis (SSIGN) Score for Renal Cell Carcinoma and 1, 3, 5, 7 and 10-year survival rates.
The SSIGN score and estimated cancer-specific survival are derived from the following criteria:

- Pathological T Category (2002 TNM staging guidelines)
- Regional lymph node status (2002 TNM staging guidelines)
- Metastasis category (2002 TNM staging guidelines)
- Tumour size
- Tumour (nuclear) grade
- 'Tumour Necrosis Present'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 12441925](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12441925/) / [DOI: 10.1097/01.ju.0000035885.91935.d5](https://doi.org/10.1097/01.ju.0000035885.91935.d5)

api_list.name: International Metastatic RCC Database Consortium (IMDC) Risk for Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the International Metastatic RCC Database Consortium (IMDC) risk score, risk group and median survival for patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma. These are calculated from six criteria:

- '<1 year from time of diagnosis to systemic therapy'
- 'Karnofsky Performance Status <80%'
- 'Hemoglobin <lower limit of normal'
- 'Corrected calcium > upper limit of normal'
- 'Neutrophils > upper limit of normal'
- 'Platelets > upper limit of normal'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 19826129](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19826129/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2008.21.4809](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2008.21.4809)
2. [PMID: 23312463](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23312463/) / [DOI: 10.1016/S1470-2045(12)70559-4](https://doi.org/10.1016/s1470-2045(12)70559-4)
3. [PMID: 23696129](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23696129/) / [DOI: 10.1002/cncr.28151](https://doi.org/10.1002/cncr.28151)
4. [PMID: 25681967](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25681967/) / [DOI: 10.1016/S1470-2045(14)71222-7](https://doi.org/10.1016/s1470-2045(14)71222-7)
5. [PMID: 28723377](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28723377/) / [ DOI: 10.1016/j.euf.2015.11.001 ](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.euf.2015.11.001)

api_list.name: Mehran Score for Post-PCI Contrast Nephropathy
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Mehran Risk Score for contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) after percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) including the risk of any CIN and the risk of CIN requiring dialysis.
The risk score and CIN risks are derived from the following criteria:

- 'Hypotension (SBP <80 for ≥1 hr requiring inotrope or balloon pump within 24 hours of cath)'
- 'Intra-aortic balloon pump'
- 'History of congestive heart failure (CHF class III/IV by New York Heart Association Classification and/or history of pulmonary edema)'
- 'Age over 75 years'
- 'Anaemia (Baseline hematocrit value <39% for men and <36% for women)'
- 'Diabetes'
- Estimated glomerular filtration rate
- Contrast volume

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 15464318](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15464318/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.jacc.2004.06.068](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jacc.2004.06.068)
2. [PMID: 23027701](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23027701/) / [DOI: 10.1002/clc.22060](https://doi.org/10.1002/clc.22060)
3. [PMID: 20923986](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20923986/) / [DOI: 10.1161/CIRCINTERVENTIONS.110.955310](https://doi.org/10.1161/circinterventions.110.955310)
4. [PMID: 21285460](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21285460/) / [DOI: 10.4037/ccn2011746](https://doi.org/10.4037/ccn2011746)
5. [PMID: 26169247](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26169247/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.jjcc.2015.05.007](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jjcc.2015.05.007)

api_list.name: Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) Score for 12 and older
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Model For End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD 2016) Score individual (12 years and older) including estimated 3-month mortality rate.
Results will be derived from serum creatinine concentration, serum bilirubin concentration, international normalised ratio, sodium concentration and whether the individual had dialysis at least twice in the past week or CVVHD for ≥24 hours in the past week.

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 11172350](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11172350/) / [DOI: 10.1053/jhep.2001.22172](https://doi.org/10.1053/jhep.2001.22172)
2. [PMID: 12512033](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12512033/) / [DOI: 10.1053/gast.2003.50016](https://doi.org/10.1053/gast.2003.50016)
3. [PMID: 14999695](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/14999695/) / [DOI: 10.1002/hep.20083](https://doi.org/10.1002/hep.20083)
4. [PMID: 17326206](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17326206/) / [DOI: 10.1002/hep.21563](https://doi.org/10.1002/hep.21563)
5. [2016 Policy Changes](https://optn.transplant.hrsa.gov/news/meld-serum-sodium-policy-changes/)
6. [PMID: 17123284](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17123284/) / [DOI: 10.1002/lt.20979](https://doi.org/10.1002/lt.20979)

api_list.name: UCLA Integrated Staging System (UISS) 5-year Prognosis for Localised and Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return the UCLA Integrated Staging System (UISS) classification and 5-year survival for renal cell carcinoma when provided with the following criteria:

- Type of renal cell carcinoma
- Metastatic disease M-stage
- Localised disease T-stage
- Fuhrman nuclear grade
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 12454113](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/12454113/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2002.05.111](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2002.05.111)
2. [PMID: 15310775](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15310775/) / [DOI: 10.1200/JCO.2004.09.104](https://doi.org/10.1200/jco.2004.09.104)

### JSON Bodies

#### Request body
**metastatic_nm_stage** is an optional field if *localised* in **disease_type** set to 'true'.
**localised_t_stage** is an optional field if *metastatic* in **disease_type** set to 'true'.

#### Response body
**metastatic_nm_stage** will return 'null' if *localised* in **disease_type** in the request body is set to 'true'.
**localised_t_stage** will return 'null' if *metastatic* in **disease_type** in the request body is set to 'true'.

api_list.name: Glomerular Filtration Rate Using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study Equation
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the Glomerular Filtration Rate of an individual according to the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Study equation. 
Calculations are based on the individual's age, sex, serum creatinine concentration and whether the individual is of black race.

4. [EPA Publication](https://hero.epa.gov/hero/index.cfm/reference/details/reference_id/658418)

api_list.name: STONE Score for Uncomplicated Ureteral Stone
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will provide the STONE Score for Uncomplicated Ureteral Stone, including risk group, estimated risk of having a ureteral stone and additional notes and advice.
The risk score, risk group and recommendation are derived from the following criteria:

- Biological sex.
- Duration of pain prior to presentation.
- Nausea and vomiting.
- 'Haematuria on urine dipstick'
- 'Race is black'

4. [PMID: 26440490](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26440490/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.annemergmed.2015.08.019](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.annemergmed.2015.08.019)

api_list.name: Acute Kidney Injury According to RIFLE Criteria
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return the RIFLE classification for Acute Kidney Injury (AKI) when provided with the following criteria:

- 'End stage renal disease (On dialysis for >3 months)'
- 'Persistent acute kidney injury (On Renal Replacement Therapy for >4 weeks)'
- Serum creatinine concentration
- Urine output
- Glomerular filtration rate

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 15312219](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15312219/) / [DOI: 10.1186/cc2872](https://doi.org/10.1186/cc2872)
2. [PMID: 17699363](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17699363/) / [DOI: 10.2215/CJN.02070606](https://doi.org/10.2215/cjn.02070606)
3. [PMID: 27818745](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27818745/) / [DOI: 10.1093/ckj/sfs160](https://doi.org/10.1093/ckj/sfs160)
4. [PMID: 26639440](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26639440/) / [DOI: 10.1038/srep17917](https://doi.org/10.1038/srep17917)

### JSON Bodies

#### Request body
**persistent_aki**, **serum_creatinine**, **urine_output** and **glomerular_filtration_rate** are optional fields if **end_stage_renal** is set to 'true'.
**serum_creatinine**, **urine_output** and **glomerular_filtration_rate** are optional fields if **end_stage_renal** and **persistent_aki** are set to 'true'.

#### Response body
**persistent_aki**, **serum_creatinine**, **urine_output** and **glomerular_filtration_rate** will return 'null' if **end_stage_renal** is set to 'true'.
**serum_creatinine**, **urine_output** and **glomerular_filtration_rate** will return 'null' if **end_stage_renal** and/or **persistent_aki** are set to 'true'.
**

api_list.name: RENAL Nephrometry Score
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the RENAL Nephrometry Score to categorise renal masses by complexity for surgical decision-making.
The RENAL nephrometry score, complexity category and risk of major complication are derived from the following criteria:

- Radius in cm (Largest diameter in any single plane).
- Exophytic/endophytic (% mass exophytic (protruding out) vs. endophytic (contained) relative to renal parenchyma).
- Nearness to collecting system or sinus in mm (shortest distance measured).
- Location relative to polar linesLocation relative to polar lines.
- Anterior/posterior (Primary location of tumor relative to coronal plane at level of hilar vessels).
- 'Hilar tumour (Touching renal artery or vein).'

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 19616235](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19616235/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.juro.2009.05.035](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.juro.2009.05.035)
2. [PMID: 22054378](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22054378/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.urology.2011.04.035](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.urology.2011.04.035)
3. [PMID: 21621910](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21621910/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.eururo.2011.05.030](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.eururo.2011.05.030)
4. [PMID: 21777362](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21777362/) / [DOI: 10.1111/j.1464-410X.2011.10452.x](https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1464-410x.2011.10452.x)
5. [PMID: 21458155](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/21458155/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.eururo.2011.03.029](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.eururo.2011.03.029)
6. [PMID: 22425078](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/22425078/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.juro.2011.12.099](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.juro.2011.12.099)
7. [PMID: 23764083](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23764083/) / [DOI: 10.1016/j.juro.2013.06.014](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.juro.2013.06.014)

api_list.name: Ideal Body Weight (IBW)
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will return the Ideal Body Weight of an individual based on their body length (**length**) and sex (**sex**).

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 6873144](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/6873144/) / [DOI: 10.1007/BF00542215](https://doi.org/10.1007/bf00542215)
2. [DOI: 10.1177/106002807400801104](https://doi.org/10.1177/106002807400801104)
3. [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/scholar_lookup?title=Therapy:+changing+dietary+concepts&author=GJ+Hamwi&publication_year=1964&)
4. [PMID: 6869387](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/6869387/) / [DOI: 10.1093/ajhp/40.6.1016](https://doi.org/10.1093/ajhp/40.6.1016)
5. [PMID: 6638023](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/6638023/)
6. [PMID: 16105412](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16105412/) / [DOI: 10.1381/0960892054621350](https://doi.org/10.1381/0960892054621350)

### JSON Bodies

## Request
At least one *unit\value* objects can be added to the array. If more than one *unit\value* objects (differing unit types are allowed) are added then these will then be summed and converted.
This is useful when for example combining 'ft' and 'in'.

api_list.name: Serum Osmolarity
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will calculate the serum osmolarity and optionally the osmolarity gap using serum sodium concentration, serum urea concentration and serum urea concentration.
These will be corrected to serum alcholol concentration if optionally added to request body. Osmolarity gap will only be returned if the optional measured osmolarity value is added.
Osmolarity and the osmolarity gap will be calculated by the traditional equation and the Purssell et al. equation. 

### Evidence
1. [PMID: 11719745](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11719745/) / [DOI: 10.1067/mem.2001.119455](https://doi.org/10.1067/mem.2001.119455)
2. [PMID: 25030781](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25030781/) / [DOI: 10.3945/ajcn.114.086769](https://doi.org/10.3945/ajcn.114.086769)

### JSON Bodies

#### Response body
The optional field **alcohol** will return 'null' if this field is left blank in the request body.
The optional field **measured_osmolarity** will return 'null' if this field is left blank in the request body.
The field **osmolarity_gap** will return 'null' if the **measured_osmolarity** field is left blank in the request body.

api_list.name: Convert Different Mass and Molar Units of Concentration
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will convert a given mass and given volume to a concentration expressed in several unit types. 
If the optional molar mass is added, molarity will also be returned and can accept mole units.

### JSON Bodies

#### Request body
If the optional molar mass is provided, the mass field will be able to accept 'pmol', 'nmol', 'umol', 'mmol' or 'mol' as units.

#### Response body
If the optional molar mass is provided, the molar concentration will be returned in addition to mass concentration. If this is not provided, molar concentration will return 'null'.

api_list.name: Convert Different Units of Mass
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will convert mass expressed in one or more common unit types to several other common unit types. Pound and ounce are avoirdupois.

### JSON Bodies

## Request
At least one *unit\value* objects can be added to the array. If more than one *unit\value* objects (differing unit types are allowed) are added then these will then be summed and converted.
This is useful when for example combining 'lb' and 'oz'.

api_list.name: Convert Different Units of Time
api_list.description:
### Description
This endpoint will convert time expressed in one or more common unit types to several other common unit types.
A 'day' is 24 hours. A 'week' is 7 days. A 'month' is 1/12th of a year (30.436875 days). A year is 365.2425 days.

### JSON Bodies

## Request
At least one *unit\value* objects can be added to the array. If more than one *unit\value* objects (differing unit types are allowed) are added then these will then be summed and converted.
This is useful when for example combining 'sec' and 'min'.
